page.title: 19Radley and the Church
page.content: The Church of St. James the Great has dominated the village since ****. It is a focal point of village life, solely providing for the village's (Church of England) religious needs:- 3 services each Sunday, 2 each weekday; baptisms, confirmations, marriages and funerals. The Vicar and the Chaplain of Radley College both take services for the Primary School, Mondays and Thursdays. The Church embraces an active bell ringing team, and a choir of 30, for Radley services and also Deanery and Diocesan Festivals, and jointly with other parishes. There is a Women's Fellowship, a Women's Institute, and a Thursday Group which does charitable work. There are Junior and Senior Church Youth Groups, and a thriving Sunday School. A new Church Room was recently build for own & hired uses.
